abstract: Your app’s response to a request ride intent.
overview:
## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentResponse] object contains your app’s response to a ride-booking request. After creating your response object, assign an appropriate object to the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentResponse/rideStatus] property. The ride status object provides the details about how you handled the ride, including details about selected vehicle type, pricing, driver information, pickup time, pickup location, drop-off location, and so on. Siri and Maps display your response information to the user during the confirmation and booking phases.

Siri and Maps expect your response to contain a valid [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRideStatus] object with information about the ride. Specifically, your status object must include a valid [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRideOption] object and you should always specify an activity object in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRideStatus/userActivityForCancelingInApplication] property of your status object. When handling the intent, the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentResponseCode/unspecified] and [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentResponseCode/ready] codes generate an error and should not be used.

You create an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentResponse] object in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentHandling/confirm(intent:completion:)] and [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentHandling/handle(intent:completion:)] methods of your handler object. For more information about implementing your handler object, see [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentHandling].

# INRequestRideIntentResponse

**Class**

Your app’s response to a request ride intent.

## Declaration

```swift
class INRequestRideIntentResponse
```

## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentResponse] object contains your app’s response to a ride-booking request. After creating your response object, assign an appropriate object to the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentResponse/rideStatus] property. The ride status object provides the details about how you handled the ride, including details about selected vehicle type, pricing, driver information, pickup time, pickup location, drop-off location, and so on. Siri and Maps display your response information to the user during the confirmation and booking phases.

Siri and Maps expect your response to contain a valid [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRideStatus] object with information about the ride. Specifically, your status object must include a valid [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRideOption] object and you should always specify an activity object in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRideStatus/userActivityForCancelingInApplication] property of your status object. When handling the intent, the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentResponseCode/unspecified] and [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentResponseCode/ready] codes generate an error and should not be used.

You create an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentResponse] object in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentHandling/confirm(intent:completion:)] and [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentHandling/handle(intent:completion:)] methods of your handler object. For more information about implementing your handler object, see [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INRequestRideIntentHandling].

## Initializing the Response Object

- **init(code:userActivity:)**: Initializes the response object with the specified code and user activity object.

## Getting the Response Code

- **code**: The code indicating whether you successfully handled the intent.
- **INRequestRideIntentResponseCode**: Constants indicating the state of the response.

## Accessing the Response Parameters

- **rideStatus**: The current status of the ride.

## Request a Ride

- **INRequestRideIntentHandling**: The handler interface for booking a ride for the user.
- **INRequestRideIntent**: A request to book the specified ride from your service.

## Inherits From

- INIntentResponse

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
